Note: There are useful notes after this page.

CIPHER.75.cipherString: Why does someone who runs marathons make a good student? Because education pays off in the long run!
CIPHER.75.question: The following quote has been encoded as an Aristocrat, what does it say?

CIPHER.98.question: Encode the following quite from Gustave Droz as a Hill cipher using a keyword of JUST.

CIPHER.77.cipherString: Affection is a garden, and without it there would not be a verdant spot on the surface of the globe.
CIPHER.77.question: The following quote is an Aristocrat that has been encoded using a K1 alphabet.  What does it say?

CIPHER.81.cipherString: Don't wait for success to become stronger and confident. Be strong and confident Success will automatically chase you
CIPHER.81.question: The following quote by Saif Rehman has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.

CIPHER.93.question: Solve the following Cryptarithm and use the mappings to decode what 235538 94894 says.

CIPHER.83.cipherString: You stare at frozen juice cans because they say, "concentrate".
CIPHER.83.question: The following symbols encode a quote using a Baconian cipher.  What does it say?

CIPHER.88.cipherString: Be humble: have the courage to speak the truth.
CIPHER.88.question: A quote by Ken Poirot has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=●–, 2=–●, 3=××, 4=–×, 5=●●

CIPHER.92.question: Solve the following cryptarithm to be able to decode what 123607 9548 decodes to.

CIPHER.78.cipherString: A politician was a person with whose politics you did not agree. When you did agree, he was a statesman.
CIPHER.78.question: The following quote by David Lloyd George has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K2 alphabet.  What did he say?

CIPHER.87.cipherString: The only real valuable thing is intuition.
CIPHER.87.question: A quote by Albert Einstein has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 9=●×, 8=–●, 7=●–, 6=×●, 5=××

CIPHER.90.cipherString: Do not get obsolete like an old technology, keep innovating yourself.
CIPHER.90.question: The following quote by Sukant Ratnakar needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of TAPE

CIPHER.80.cipherString: The world must be made safe for democracy. Its peace must be planted upon the tested foundations of political liberty.
CIPHER.80.question: The following quote by Woodrow Wilson has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What did he say?

CIPHER.84.cipherString: Why didn't the dog want to play football? It was a boxer!
CIPHER.84.question: The following strange sentences are a Baconian cipher which poses an interesting question that starts with WHYD.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.96.cipherString: Both the man of science and the man of action live always at the edge of mystery, surrounded by it.
CIPHER.96.question: The following quote by J. Robert Oppenheimer has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What Key Phrase was used to construct that alphabet?

CIPHER.89.cipherString: Support bacteria, it's the only culture some people have.
CIPHER.89.question: The following quote from a bumper sticker has been encoded as a Fractionated Morse cipher that ends with HAVE.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.82.cipherString: A single rose can be my garden… a single friend, my world.
CIPHER.82.question: The following symbols are a Baconian Cipher of a quote by Leo Buscaglia.  What did they say?

CIPHER.99.question: Decode the following quote which was encoded using a Hill cipher with a keyword of THRU.

CIPHER.91.cipherString: The river of emotions will almost always over-run the barrage of logic.
CIPHER.91.question: The following quote by Wasif Minhas needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of LAKE

CIPHER.97.cipherString: Where does the Easter Bunny go when he needs a new tail? To a retail store!
CIPHER.97.question: The following quote has been encoded as a RailFence cipher using 5 rails.  What does it say?

CIPHER.95.cipherString: Some people only gets called by their nicknames. Usually it sounds weird to even say their real name.
CIPHER.95.question: The following observation has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What was the key phrase used to encode it?

CIPHER.79.cipherString: In madders of cnoscience first thouhgts are bets, in madders of prudnece last thoughst aer bset.
CIPHER.79.question: Your friend who can't spell or type very well is trying to offer you some advice which has then been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What did they actually type in?

CIPHER.86.cipherString: When we are centered in joy, we attain our wisdom.
CIPHER.86.question: A quote by Marianne Williamson has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=●, 3=–, 5=×, 7=×, 9=–

CIPHER.94.cipherString: Every intelligent being, whether it breathes or not, coughs nervously at some time in its life.
CIPHER.94.question: the following quote by Terry Pratchett has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K3 alphabet.  What was the key phrase used to encode it?

CIPHER.85.cipherString: Recuerda siempre a las personas que te han ayudado en el camino, y no olvides levantar a alguien.
CIPHER.85.question: The following quote by Roy T. Bennett has been translated into Spanish and encoded as an Aristocrat using an K1 English keyword.  What was the Spanish translation?
CIPHER.85.translation: Always remember people who have helped you along the way, and don't forget to lift someone up.

CIPHER.76.cipherString: You'd think that with NSA reading our tweets all the time, they could star or retweet some of the good ones.
CIPHER.76.question: The following observation has been encoded as an Aristocrat.  What does it say?
